awd_titl_txt: Analysis of Hydrothermal Activity in the Oceanic Ridges
awd_abstract_narration: Theis is a theoretical study of the dynamics of hydrothermal            processes beneath ridge.crest thermal areas. A theoretical analog               of the natural system has been designed to facilitate analyses of               the interaction among processes that redistribute energy and mass               from the pluton sized magma bodies near the bottom of the ocean                 crust through percolation networks in the overlying rocks. The                  objective of the study is to predict the magnitude and                          periodicity of long and short term variations of field parameters               in the subsurface beneath active hot springs that are caused by                 local feedbacks amongst the transport processes. The study will                 focus primarily on the behavior of hydrothermal activity at state               conditions that coincide with the near field of the critical                    region of the fluid.
